text:
="preserve">Digital 3D is a non-specific 3D standard in which movies, television shows, and video games are presented and shot in digital 3D technology or later processed in digital post-production to add a 3D effect.
One of the first studios to use digital 3D was Walt Disney Pictures. The 2008 animated feature "Bolt" was the first movie which was animated and rendered for digital 3D.
